page.title: 01Haddo House and Policies
page.content: Half of the area is partially wooded, which is unusual in this region. The trees have been planted and do not occur naturally. The main feature is Haddo House, the home of Lady Aberdeen. The house is under the care of the National Trust and is open to the public from May to October. Haddo Country Park is open to the public throughout the year and the Haddo "Rangers" organise talks to encourage a greater awareness of the countryside. International concerts and Amateur Dramatics are held in the Library in the House and in the adjacent Community Hall. The remaining area is rural - few farm buildings, rough grassland and farmland. The land gently undulates.
